verb.description: To produce artistic, literary, or other creative work solely to make a living by catering to popular taste, without regard to artistic quality.
To produce (artistic, literary, or other creative work) solely to make a living by catering to popular taste, without regard to artistic quality.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Dante Gabriel Rossetti (1828–1882), painter and poet. From pot + boil, after potboiler.
